name: Niv-Mizzet, the Firemind
text:
Flying
Whenever you draw a card, Niv-Mizzet, the Firemind deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
{T}: Draw a card.

editions.flavor: As brilliant as a cut diamond, and with just as cruel an edge.

name: Nix
text: Counter target spell if no mana was spent to cast it.

editions.flavor:
"There is no shortcut to work done true and well. The Creators learned this to their sorrow, the first time they made the world."
—Githri the Prisoner

name: Nobilis of War
text:
Flying
Attacking creatures you control get +2/+0.

editions.flavor:
"A great siege is a banquet to him; a long and terrible battle, the most exquisite delicacy."
—The Seer's Parables

"A great siege is a banquet to him; a long and terrible battle, the most exquisite delicacy."
—The Seer's Parables

"A great siege is a banquet to him; a long and terrible battle, the most exquisite delicacy."
—The Seer's Parables

name: Noble Banneret
text:
Draft Noble Banneret face up.
As you draft a creature card, you may reveal it, note its name, then turn Noble Banneret face down.
As long as you control one or more creatures with a name you noted for cards named Noble Banneret, Noble Banneret and those creatures get +1/+1 and have lifelink.

name: Noble Benefactor
text: When Noble Benefactor dies, each player may search his or her library for a card and put that card into his or her hand. Then each player who searched his or her library this way shuffles it.

name: Noble Elephant
text: Trample; banding (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)

editions.flavor:
"Proud am I, / strong am I, / courageous in defending my children / and fierce in punishing what stands in my way."
—"So the Elephant Speaks,"
Zhalfirin song

name: Noble Hierarch
text:
Exalted (Whenever a creature you control attacks alone, that creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
{T}: Add {G}, {W}, or {U} to your mana pool.

editions.flavor: She protects the sacred groves from blight, drought, and the Unbeholden.
She protects the sacred groves from blight, drought, and the Unbeholden.
She protects the sacred groves from blight, drought, and the Unbeholden.

name: Noble Panther
text: {1}: Noble Panther gains first strike until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Unlike many hunters, these panthers have no need for camouflage. They're fast enough to catch any prey.

name: Noble Purpose
text: Whenever a creature you control deals combat damage, you gain that much life.

editions.flavor: Fighting for the right reason is itself a source of strength.
Fighting for the right reason is itself a source of strength.

name: Noble Quarry
text:
Bestow {5}{G} (If you cast this card for its bestow cost, it's an Aura spell with enchant creature. It becomes a creature again if it's not attached to a creature.)
All creatures able to block Noble Quarry or enchanted creature do so.
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1.

name: Noble Stand
text: Whenever a creature you control blocks, you gain 2 life.

editions.flavor: Soldiers will always endanger their lives to defend many other lives.

name: Noble Steeds
text: {1}{W}: Target creature gains first strike until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"They are fighters as fine as any Knight they carry."
—Arna Kennerüd, Skycaptain

"Only an animal born in the wild has sufficient heart to be a true Knight's steed."
—King Darien of Kjeldor

name: Noble Templar
text:
Vigilance
Plainscycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Search your library for a Plains card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.)

name: Noble Vestige
text:
Flying
{T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to target player this turn.

editions.flavor: Most spirits are chained to this world by their despair, but he remains tethered by his hope for better days.

name: Nocturnal Raid
text: Black creatures get +2/+0 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: The Eastern Paladin doesn't attack at night for the tactical advantage. He does it for the sheer joy of fighting beneath the moon.

"The finest offering of night is not stealth but daring."
—Tetlok, Breathstealer

name: No-Dachi
text:
Equipped creature gets +2/+0 and has first strike.
Equip {3} ({3}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)

editions.flavor: Not keen-edged enough for cutting armor, the no-dachi slew by folding its victim rapidly and violently under the weight of its impact.

name: Noetic Scales
text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, return to its owner's hand each creature that player controls with power greater than the number of cards in his or her hand.

name: Noggin Whack
text:
Prowl {1}{B} (You may cast this for its prowl cost if you dealt combat damage to a player this turn with a Rogue.)
Target player reveals three cards from his or her hand. You choose two of them. That player discards those cards.

name: Noggle Bandit
text: Noggle Bandit can't be blocked except by creatures with defender.

editions.flavor: Noggles believe that they were the first race ever to walk Shadowmoor. They don't "steal." They just take back what's rightfully theirs.

name: Noggle Bridgebreaker
text: When Noggle Bridgebreaker enters the battlefield, return a land you control to its owner's hand.

editions.flavor: "It's always funny till someone gets hurt. Then it's hilarious."

name: Noggle Hedge-Mage
text:
When Noggle Hedge-Mage enters the battlefield, if you control two or more Islands, you may tap two target permanents.
When Noggle Hedge-Mage enters the battlefield, if you control two or more Mountains, you may have Noggle Hedge-Mage deal 2 damage to target player.

name: Noggle Ransacker
text: When Noggle Ransacker enters the battlefield, each player draws two cards, then discards a card at random.

editions.flavor: Noggles live purely by what they can scavenge. There is not a single thing a noggle eats, wears, or uses that did not once belong to another.

name: Nomad Decoy
text:
{W}, {T}: Tap target creature.
Threshold — {W}{W}, {T}: Tap two target creatures. Activate this ability only if seven or more cards are in your graveyard.

editions.flavor: If you can take something from a nomad, it's probably bait.

name: Nomadic Elf
text: {1}{G}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

editions.set: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. the Coalition
editions.flavor: "I've journeyed across Dominaria. Phyrexians are everywhere. Plague is everywhere. There's no place left to hide."
"I've journeyed across Dominaria. Phyrexians are everywhere. Plague is everywhere. There's no place left to hide."

name: Nomad Mythmaker
text: {W}, {T}: Put target Aura card from a graveyard onto the battlefield under your control attached to a creature you control.

editions.flavor: On the wild steppes, history vanishes in the dust. Only the mythmakers remain to say what was, and is, and will be.
Nomads weave tales thicker than tapestries.

name: Nomad Outpost
text:
Nomad Outpost enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {R}, {W}, or {B} to your mana pool.

editions.flavor:
"Only the weak imprison themselves behind walls. We live free under the wind, and our freedom makes us strong."
—Zurgo, khan of the Mardu

—Zurgo, khan of the Mardu

text:
Create a 1/1 white Kor Soldier creature token for each creature you control.
Rebound (If you cast this spell from your hand, exile it as it resolves. At the beginning of your next upkeep, you may cast this card from exile without paying its mana cost.)

name: Nomads en-Kor
text: {0}: The next 1 damage that would be dealt to Nomads en-Kor this turn is dealt to target creature you control instead.

editions.flavor: The Kor forsake roots for the winding of the path; forsake voices for the silence of the mind; forsake all else for the poverty of isolation.
The kor forsake roots for the winding of the path, forsake voices for the silence of the mind, forsake all else for the poverty of isolation.

text:
{T}: Add {W} to your mana pool. Nomad Stadium deals 1 damage to you.
Threshold — {W}, {T}, Sacrifice Nomad Stadium: You gain 4 life. Activate this ability only if seven or more cards are in your graveyard.

name: No Mercy
text: Whenever a creature deals damage to you, destroy it.

editions.flavor:
"We had years to prepare, while they had mere minutes."
—Kerrick, sleeper agent

text:
Whenever a creature becomes blocked by a creature with lesser power, destroy the blocking creature.
Whenever a creature blocks a creature with lesser power, destroy the attacking creature.

editions.flavor: As Gerrard and Greven neared each other, the moggs caught between them realized they should flee.

name: No Rest for the Wicked

editions.flavor: "I have a bad feeling about this."

name: Norn's Annex
text:
({W/P} can be paid with either {W} or 2 life.)

{T}: Choose target non-Wall creature the active player has controlled continuously since the beginning of the turn. That creature attacks this turn if able. If it doesn't, destroy it at the beginning of the next end step. Activate this ability only before attackers are declared.

name: Norwood Priestess

name: Norwood Riders
text: Norwood Riders can't be blocked by more than one creature.

editions.flavor: "Trade my moose? Sure—when I find a horse that can spear ten goblins at a time!"

name: Norwood Warrior
text: Whenever Norwood Warrior becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: "The woods hold peace for those who desire it, but those who seek battle will find me."

name: Nostalgic Dreams
text:
As an additional cost to cast Nostalgic Dreams, discard X cards.
Return X target cards from your graveyard to your hand. Exile Nostalgic Dreams.

editions.flavor: Seton dreams of life renewed.

name: Nosy Goblin
text: {T}, Sacrifice Nosy Goblin: Destroy target face-down creature.

editions.flavor: To his surprise, Furt discovered that the strange creatures were not at all like bugs.

name: Not Forgotten
text: Put target card from a graveyard on the top or bottom of its owner's library. Create a 1/1 white Spirit creature token with flying.

editions.flavor: Visit the dead, and they may return the favor.

name: Nothing Can Stop Me Now
text:
(An ongoing scheme remains face up until it's abandoned.)
If a source an opponent controls would deal damage to you, prevent 1 of that damage.
At the beginning of each end step, if you've been dealt 5 or more damage this turn, abandon this scheme.

name: Notion Thief
text:
Flash
If an opponent would draw a card except the first one he or she draws in each of his or her draw steps, instead that player skips that draw and you draw a card.

name: Not of This World
text:
Counter target spell or ability that targets a permanent you control.
Not of This World costs {7} less to cast if it targets a spell or ability that targets a creature you control with power 7 or greater.

name: Notorious Assassin
text: {2}{B}, {T}, Discard a card: Destroy target nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.

editions.flavor: He wears his infamy like a fine silk shirt.

name: Notorious Throng
text:
Prowl {5}{U} (You may cast this for its prowl cost if you dealt combat damage to a player this turn with a Rogue.)
Create X 1/1 black Faerie Rogue creature tokens with flying, where X is the damage dealt to your opponents this turn. If Notorious Throng's prowl cost was paid, take an extra turn after this one.

name: Nourish
text: You gain 6 life.

editions.flavor: Gelfruit grows abundantly wherever Sylvok druids live, as if the Tangle knows that humans are not as hardy as the beasts or as nimble as the elves.

name: Nourishing Shoal
text:
You may exile a green card with converted mana cost X from your hand rather than pay Nourishing Shoal's mana cost.
You gain X life.

name: Novablast Wurm
text: Whenever Novablast Wurm attacks, destroy all other creatures.

editions.flavor:
"The sun was born within its coils, but it fled to the sky. The wurm hungers for its child, and the world will bear its loss."
—Screed of the Mul Daya

name: Nova Chaser
text:
Trample
Champion an Elemental (When this enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you exile another Elemental you control. When this leaves the battlefield, that card returns to the battlefield.)

name: Nova Cleric
text: {2}{W}, {T}, Sacrifice Nova Cleric: Destroy all enchantments.

editions.flavor: "Our noblest thoughts are our very first and our very last."

name: Nova Pentacle
text: {3}, {T}: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, that damage is dealt to target creature of an opponent's choice instead.

text:
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.
{G}{U}, {T}: Put a +1/+1 counter on each creature that entered the battlefield this turn.

name: Now I Know My ABC's
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, if you control permanents with names that include all twenty-six letters of the English alphabet, you win the game.

editions.flavor: The quick onyx goblin jumps over the lazy dwarf.

name: Noxious Dragon
text:
Flying
When Noxious Dragon dies, you may destroy target creature with converted mana cost 3 or less.

editions.flavor: Dragons of Silumgar's brood begin to digest their prey even before consuming it, letting their caustic breath do much of the work.

name: Noxious Field
text:
Enchant land
Enchanted land has "{T}: This land deals 1 damage to each creature and each player."

editions.flavor: Ultimately, it became a three-way battle: the land attacked both armies.

name: Noxious Gearhulk
text:
Menace
When Noxious Gearhulk enters the battlefield, you may destroy another target creature. If a creature is destroyed this way, you gain life equal to its toughness.

name: Noxious Ghoul
text: Whenever Noxious Ghoul or another Zombie enters the battlefield, all non-Zombie creatures get -1/-1 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Plague and death wrapped in one convenient package.
Plague and death wrapped in one convenient package.

name: Noxious Hatchling
text:

Wither (This deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters.)

name: Noxious Revival
text:
({G/P} can be paid with either {G} or 2 life.)
Put target card from a graveyard on top of its owner's library.

editions.flavor:
"Dead or alive, my creations are stronger than Jin-Gitaxias's septic minions."
—Vorinclex, Voice of Hunger

name: Noxious Toad
text: When Noxious Toad dies, each opponent discards a card.

name: Noxious Vapors
text: Each player reveals his or her hand and chooses one card of each color from it, then discards all other nonland cards.

editions.flavor: Urborg would just as soon steal your memories as your life.

name: Noyan Dar, Roil Shaper
text: Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell, you may put three +1/+1 counters on target land you control. If you do, that land becomes a 0/0 Elemental creature with haste that's still a land.

editions.flavor: After many years as a lullmage, Noyan Dar turned his talents from allaying Zendikar's fury to the considerably easier task of rousing it.
After many years as a lullmage, Noyan Dar turned his talents from allaying Zendikar's fury to the considerably easier task of rousing it.

name: Nucklavee
text:
When Nucklavee enters the battlefield, you may return target red sorcery card from your graveyard to your hand.
When Nucklavee enters the battlefield, you may return target blue instant card from your graveyard to your hand.

editions.flavor: It loathes all tastes but two: spells and flesh.
It loathes all tastes but two: spells and flesh.
It loathes all tastes but two: spells and flesh.

editions.flavor: All Auriok children know the tale, "Bolgri and the Long Day of Squashing."

text: {2}, {T}, Discard your hand: Counter target noncreature spell.

editions.flavor:
Give away everything so others have nothing.
—Brooch inscription

name: Null Caller
text: {3}{B}, Exile a creature card from your graveyard: Create a tapped 2/2 black Zombie creature token.

editions.flavor: Zendikar's defenders include both healers and vampires. One way or another, the fallen will return to the fight.

name: Null Chamber
text:
As Null Chamber enters the battlefield, you and an opponent each name a card other than a basic land card.
The named cards can't be played.

name: Nullmage Shepherd

editions.flavor: The shepherds work in secret, seeking out abominations against nature and returning them to earth and dust.

name: Null Profusion
text:

editions.flavor:
